The Temple of the Blood God is a one-shot dungeon crawl for parties at level 5 or 9 for the 5th and 3.5 editions! Featuring daunting new monsters and a multitude of obstacles for players to overcome, it can be easily dropped into any jungle adventure as a point of interest.

About the Temple of the Blood God
A jungle-themed dungeon crawl filled with undead and flora, brought to life by the magic of the Goddess of Blood, ready to pounce on the players!

Interesting jungle discovery to point party to search for a forgotten piece of occult-related lore.

Setting agnostic - the Temple can be located in any fantasy world and jungle!

boardgame.name: Munahhemana: The Chosen One
boardgame.description:
With the Lord of the heavens and the earth echoing the commands to the Holy Prophet (PBUH), a divine revelation came about 1400 years ago. This advent had been promised in the Abrahamic religions, including Christianity. His name was "the Chosen One" and has been narrated in various languages throughout history. The name commenced its journey from the ancient Syriac language with Munahhemana (ܡܢܚܡܢܐ), passed by Greek with Periclutos (περικλυτος) and then landed in the Gospel of John with Paraclete. This name has since remained in the hearts and minds of generations to come. In the Gospel of John, the Prophet Jesus (PBUH) said, "I am announcing the coming of someone who, if I do not leave you, will not come… “He will teach you everything and recollect what I have told you”… “When he comes he will bring justice and equity to the world". Ultimately, the Chosen One, named Muhammad (PBUH), appeared in the Arabian Peninsula. He, along with his companions, migrated to Medina to build the Abrahamic civilization.

Munahhemana needs citizens who will help him build the new civilization with their production and economics, dedication and obedience, intelligence and politics, and science and wisdom. In the Game of Munahhemana, various challenging events and important missions occur. Herein, only tribes with specific characteristics can support Munahhemana. They must find the balance between the strengthening of their tribes’ power and carrying out missions assigned to them.

ROUTINE, CO-OP or SOLO. You can choose and play any of these three modes. In routine mode, you compete with other players, while in co-op mode, you collectively work together, and finally, in solo mode, you work alone to play the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Viticulture World: First Game Continent Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
Ease into the cooperative challenge of the Viticulture World expansion with this first-game promo pack. This is completely optional and only available from Stonemaier Games.

Contains 9 cards.

boardgame.name: Viticulture World Replacement Cards: South America
boardgame.description: In the original printing of the South America continent for Viticulture World, we made the mistake of including two conquistadors as characters whom players can leverage for special abilities. The actions of these conquistadors came at a grave cost to indigenous peoples, and even with a strong disclaimer, we now realize that these are not people worth memorializing in any way. We ask that you replace the cards referencing Cortez and Pizarro with the cards in this pack.

boardgame.name: O'Tali's Bizaare
boardgame.description:
O'Tali's Bizaare is a culmination of shops, inn's, gambling dens, hired guns, and more! The vendors in O'Tali's Bizzare either thrive in the chaotic ebb and flow of the bizarre or owe O'Tali a great deal of debt. These same vendors often travel outside the safety of the bizarre to find rare resources, priceless artifacts, or slay great beasts to sell in their shops. The market is competitive, and vendors must do whatever it takes to stay in demand.

Gameplay:

O'Tali's Bizaare is a engine building RPG were players try to gain the most from their sales, over a limited set of rounds. The day/night cycle gives players a wide array of activities and ways to win.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Wall: Fatal Error
boardgame.description:
Three boxes for three stories await you: work in a team and ask the right questions... the answers may surprise you.

'The Wall - Fatal Error' is part of a trilogy: three investigating games that will keep you nailed to the table with bated breath!

Try to shed light on a mysterious event, collecting valuable clues between places to explore carefully, objects to analyze, and pressing interrogations. At the end of the investigation, you will be asked some questions that will measure how able you have been in solving the mystery, getting points for each correct answer. Each investigation is divided into several chapters that will allow you to continue the investigation. The detective's work seems to never end, and one case leads to another: if you feel able to answer the final questions, turn the card!

In The Wall - Fatal Error, a young computer programmer is found dead in her own home. On the crime scene there are few clues and the suspects are hiding something. You and your department will have to analyze each and every detail, evidence and testimony to discover the truth. But will it be what you are expecting?

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Anunnaki: Origins Of The Gods
boardgame.description: A narrative campaign with 8 replayable scenarios and 7 asymmetrical reward sets to the core game.

boardgame.name: The Thief Lord's Vault
boardgame.description:
From the front cover:

The dungeons beneath Punjar have a history as old as the city itself. The first tunnels were dug by smugglers, which were enlarged by successive bands of rogues, an evolution that culminated in the formation of the first Thieves Guild of Punjar. When it came time to fill the growing dungeon with traps, the Guild hired the legendary dwarf Prester “Trapmaster” Ungart. To ensure that the dungeon's secrets were never revealed, the guild sent a team of eleven assassins to Prester’s residence. In the morning, all eleven assassins were found dead. The Trapmaster the tome containing the dungeon's secrets had vanished. Now, years later, the thief lord Cazül the Chaotic has seized control of the Guild, and his eyes are on the prizes in the tunnels…

boardgame.name: Khârn-Âges
boardgame.description:
Khârn-Âges is a medieval fantasy skirmish game in which you lead a Spearhead (name given to your team of miniatures). These Spearheads are composed of anthropomorphic animals of 54mm (this is a guideline, many species are larger, including Tembos that sometimes reach 170mm!!!).

The same miniature can correspond to several profile levels, and you can equip it as you wish, so you have the possibility to play it with different characteristics while changing its weapons and equipment, or to have access to many different spells for the magicians.

Khârn-Âges is a scenario game, it's not about "wiping-out" your opponent (even if it's possible sometimes!), but about fulfilling your objectives to win. Playable on 60x60 cm, a whole series of immersive scenarios are usable in the rulebook.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Depths of Darkness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Adventurer Party in "The Depths of Darkness" begin as former nobles and freemen who have been captured and enslaved by a despicable band of ruthless pirates. The Adventurer Party are faced with a desolate situation on a seemingly uninhabited island and put to work in an ancient mine, along with other captives. Is there more to the mine than meets the eye? Perhaps with resourcefulness, skills, and luck, the Adventurer Party may be presented with opportunities to regain their former lives and restore their honour. The Adventurer Party may come across vile creatures, lifeless but living Ettins, cruel-hearted manfolk, and even deities and powerful spirits.

User summary:

Intended for use with MYFAROG (2nd Ed.)

boardgame.name: The Hall of Ettin Terror
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Myth Module begins in the village of Spirit Cove in Erulia on the day of the Summer Solstice High Festival and the birthdays of the deities Fraujôn and SuwilaR. During the entirety of the High Festival, many of the local Maenads play key roles in the rituals; in particular the youngest Maenad, whose name is Erika. If one of the players wishes, he could play this Myth as Erika the Maenad. In such a scenario, it would be a good for the player to have good knowledge of the proceedings of the Summer Solstice (these can be found in the ‘High Festivals’ section of the MYFAROG rulebook). After taking the part in the High Festival, the Adventure Party (hereby just abbreviated to AP) are asked to investigate the killing of a rural scout in a hillside village to the south called Lindon. Rumours of dreaded Ettin Phenomena bring fear to the hearts of the locals, as the second rural scout, who barely survived, brings home news of the alien creatures.

boardgame.name: Thunderbirds Danger Zone: The Game
boardgame.description:
Based on the classic British sci-fi television series, Thunderbirds: Danger Zone is a fast-paced cooperative family card game.

Send the International Rescue Team out into the Danger Zone on daring rescues and bring them home safely to Tracy Island. Players collaborate to bring fuel, weapons, knowledge and team spirit efficiently into the game under the expert guidance of Jeff Tracy.

Using characters and missions from the original TV series, players work as a team to avert disasters worldwide and beyond. Players take turns as Jeff, deciding what resource needs to be deployed and where. Players might use their cards to help get the right amount of fuel Scott needs for a rescue or to deliver the tools and gadgets needed by Lady Penelope to chase The Hood. Only Jeff can make the changes needed to ensure success. Every moment counts and if the numbers don't add up vital time will be lost. Can you work as a member of the International Rescue Team, save those in peril and bring everyone home safely?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Match Madness Duo
boardgame.description:
Shift your brain into higher gear in this clever game of logic and perception. Be quick to recreate a pattern on a card with your set of 5 blocks! Perfect dual fun for up to 2 players!

Flip the top card from the playing deck and reveal a pattern card. The first player to successfully match the pattern grabs the card and shows their block configuration to their opponent.

The player with the most card at the end wins.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Comixxx Swap
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Swap tile puzzle game with naked women in a drawn art style.

boardgame.name: Ogre Cave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the ogre caves in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Comixxx Temptations
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Puzzle game that require you to memorize a series of tiles in order and click them to reveal images of naked comic book style drawn ladies.

boardgame.name: Port Town
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the port towns in your campaign.

boardgame.name: 200 Weird West Odd Situations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With this list of 200 western themed odd situations, find out what dangers are awaiting in the country where all dreams can come true…

This supplement contains 200 situations divided between 10 locations (small town, big city, desert, river, saloon, ranch, gold mine, train, fort and penitentiary). Half of the situations are "weird west" oriented, meaning that they involve magic or paranormal elements.

boardgame.name: Nightmare of the Naga
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mystical underwater saga in the Domain of Delight, Samsara.

Time has been tampered with and the nightmarish unraveling of an archfey has disastrous consequences on the domain. Tasked to travel through time, space and dreams, you must save us all from this nightmare.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Fates or Fables?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fates or Fables is a one-shot adventure balanced for four tier 1 characters, and is written and designed by an African American with heavy influences from their culture.

When the party's boat is thrown upon an unknown island, the party encounters a usurped royal family of demi-gods looking to reclaim their throne. Can the party infiltrate the palace of the current ruling family to restore the rightful heirs, or will the whole island suffer the catastrophe of an island disconnected from those who protect it.

boardgame.name: Of Sand and Spiders
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Of Sand and Spiders is a one-shot adventure balanced for a party of four 4th-level characters based on the mythology of Anansi the Spider.

When the party comes upon a war torn oasis, they are drafted by Anansi the Spider to bring and end to the war and peace to the region. Acting as diplomats to the four warring princes, can the party convince the princes to stop the feud, or will they need to resort to trickery and deceit?

boardgame.name: The Binding of the Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Binding of the Book is a one-shot balanced for a party of four 7th-level characters written by a Chinese author with heavy influences of their culture.

When the adventurers are summoned to help recover an ancient manuscript they realize recovering the ancient text will be far more
perilous than they intended.

boardgame.name: The Search for Naupaka
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Search for Naupaka is a one-shot adventure balanced for four 4th-level characters, and is written and designed by a polynesian author with heavy influences from their culture.

When the party's boat is thrown upon an unknown island by abberrant currents, they find a hostile welcome amid the plants dying wildlife. Though not all forces work against them. A peculiar elder knows the true reasons for the islands slow death, and send the party on quest that, if successful, will not only save the island, but give rise to something completely new...

boardgame.name: Mother's Call
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mysterious voice calls the adventurers to come to her aid. Will you answer the call?

Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 5
Experience from Completion: ~6,200 XP
General Theme: Boss Fights
Setting: Any, Starlight Chronicles
Sessions to Finish: x1 session - x3 hours

boardgame.name: Cemetery of St Caligo in the Swamp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An old cemetery, slowly sinking into the swamp

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30x60 battlemaps depicting an old cemetery sinking into a bayou or swamp. Day & night versions, with interior and exterior views, plus rooftop overlays.

boardgame.name: Cemetery of St Nemus in the Glade
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An old cemetery, slowly reclaimed by nature

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30x60 battlemaps depicting the interior/exterior of an old cemetery in the forest

boardgame.name: Cemetery of St Perdita in the Jungle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Overgrown with vines, an ancient cemetery

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x60 battlemap depicting an old graveyard in the jungle. Includes interior and exterior views, plus rooftop overlays.

boardgame.name: Haghome Creek
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A flooded bayou and the home to a coven of hags

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x60 battlemap depicting a flooded forest with huts belonging to a coven of witches. Includes interior and exterior, plus roof overlay.

boardgame.name: The Circle of Highsnow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

High atop an icy mountain top stands the Circle of Highsnow

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 30x30 battlemaps depicting a stone circle of monoliths on a winter mountain top, surrounding a red tree.
Includes non-tree version, and bonus version with igloos for winter druids.

boardgame.name: Potbellied Kobold's Guide to Villains & Lairs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Potbellied Kobold's Guide to Villains & Lairs is a 5E supplement containing villainous NPCs for you to add to your gaming sessions. One of these villains might be the inspiration for your next campagin, or you might add one or two to your current campaign as side-quests, persons of interest, or as onging enemies. These aren't just stat blocks! We proivde you with the villain's history, their motives, flaws, personality, special equipment, unique magic items, and a stat block.

Gamemaster Tools - The book also contains a Gamemaster Tools section, providing you with inspiration and tips for creating your next villain and dangerous lair.

Included in this supplement:

33 villainous NPCs ranging in Challange Rating from 1 to 21
New equipment, treasure, and magic items specific to the villains
Amazing art for each villain
15 beautifully mapped lairs for your adventurers to explore
Gamemaster Tools to help inspire you when creating your own villainouss NPCs and their lairs

boardgame.name: Railroad Ink: Expansions Box
boardgame.description:
Store the extras for Railroad Ink game series in one single, dedicated box!

This magnetically-sealed box can hold all the seven expansions for the core games, as well as the extra boards, markers, and objective cards.

boardgame.name: Starship Engineer's Course
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement is intended to help game referees by providing useful details about what a starship Engineer -1 ought to know and what they need to do each day. If you think that being an engineer is like being a medic, your skill is only needed when something goes wrong, you’re mistaken. But what do they do all day? Sit and stare at the controls, hoping to notice something?

Of course, an Engineer needs a ship. The Zhook is an odd-looking ship, Few people know its origins, if they did, they might be less willing to work aboard her. Of course, crew do leave ships and new crew are always needed, but if you serve on the Zhook you’ll remember it forever.
There’s a secretive alien race to play with too.

boardgame.name: Krutok
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With its retinue of mind numb, pack laden humanoid servants in tow, the gruesome, two headed, ‘cruel talking’ krutok crosses the rubble strewn wastes. Some of its drooling, half-witted toys are on their last legs, and need replacing. That’s when it spots the team of worn out excavators as they leave the ruins.

After examining the dig team and bickering among itself for a moment, it sees that the humans are wounded and don’t appear to have any serious firepower. Half will serve as food, the others as pack animals and playthings.

Its mind made up, this sac bellied freak makes its move. It sends a mentally controlled giant garnock to start the show with a diversion on the right flank, and two almost brain dead skullocks to attack on the left. The hunt is on.

The krutok is our 20th Monday Mutant for The Mutant Epoch (TME) Tabletop RPG. This new freak makes alternating mental or energy attacks with its two heads, plus, is superbly defended from close quarter attacks by of dozens of pus and gas filled sacs which hang from its globular, reddish-purple body. Any hit on this thing will cause a sac to burst, unleashing one of many possible disgusting liquids, gases, or obscuring substances, including radioactive powder.

The krutok supplement includes a table to determine what random mutation one of its heads unleashes each round, plus a sac rupture table, along with a brief servant table. These mentally subservient, drooling captives are controlled by the krutok to do its bidding, endure its sick torments, carry its stuff, and sacrifice themselves when the master creature is attacked. Learn more about this horrid new mutie in the 6 page PDF.

boardgame.name: Noxious Threat
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A renegade mage has barely managed to escape after a failed coup attempt against his master. Now, he must be brought to justice. However, he has already found new, poisonous allies...

Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 5
Experience from Completion: ~11,700 XP
General Theme: Exploration, Elimination
Setting: Any, Starlight Chronicles
Sessions to Finish: x1 session - x3 hours

boardgame.name: The Traveler's Guide to Darkwood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Traveler’s Guide to the Darkwood is a ‘zine-size 5e supplement full of new ancestries, classes, transformations, nine new backgrounds that give you cool stuff to spend your hit dice on, and dozens of new monsters forming five new factions locked in a struggle for control of the titular Darkwood.

Play as the new greenfolk ancestry, little plant people with some natural druidic magic and a tremorsense as they root into the earth nearby, or use natural symbiosis to transform a character of any ancestry into a wood woad, a shambling mound, or ultimately, a mighty treant. Play as the new Spore Bomber class, an artillery focused class with tons of poison, psychic, and piercing damage, and which can seize control of both the living and the dead with parasitic fungus. Basically, imagine if the Circle of Spores Druid got rid of all the standard Druid stuff to instead be all fungal artillery, all the time.

It wouldn’t be much of a guide to the Darkwood without a guide to the actual Darkwood, with six different sub-regions each with their own conflicts between a grand total of five or seven or nine different factions, depending on exactly how you count them. The core six factions have been given a complete stat block overhaul, with new action-oriented bosses, like the aarakocra’s arcane archer and shaman, the fomorian troll, bigger and nastier than the average, and the dark druid Thornhearts’ sinister archdruid leader, Grandfather Kierath.

The monsters, sub-regions, and entire region of the Darkwood itself are designed with an eye of the grand GMing tradition of stripping the setting for parts to use in your own homebrew, and also plug into the greater Weskven setting that this series will be building and donating to the Creative Commons so that every third party publisher doesn’t have to make their own new setting from scratch. We also donate the art to the Creative Commons after a while.

Seven of those factions also get new backgrounds, allowing you to emulate the devastating abilities of those bosses by spending hit dice, and the Outlander and Folk Hero also get a rewrite to the new system, with new powers unlocked at levels 5, 9, 13, and 17. You can use the new background to give yourself a soft multiclass, for example, taking Outlander to grant yourself some Ranger or Druid features even if otherwise you’re a Rogue or Sorcerer or whatever, or you can use them to reinforce your class, using the Outlander to extend your Ranger or Druid powers by using hit dice to cast when you’ve run out of spell slots. And these backgrounds remain fully compatible with other first party backgrounds, which use all of their hit dice for healing on a short rest, which is less fun, but still a perfectly effective thing to spend your hit dice on.

In addition to the standard forty or fifty pages of new content I’ve been producing every month for a year now, this book also contains some reprinted stuff from Chamomile’s Guide to Everything, to ensure that new supporters have everything they need to play the Darkwood, with no other books necessary, including playable werewolves, dryads, and myconids from Celawyn and Kessler, the Summoner, Shapeshifter, and Healer classes from Celawyn and Thaemin, the Beast Friend Ranger and Beast Whisperer Barbarian from Celawyn and Cora, and the Injuries system from Ozaka.

Of course, while I’ve included everything necessary to playing the Darkwood in the Darkwood book, lots of things which aren’t strictly necessary but still very cool have been left out in order to keep the formatting, printing, and shipping costs under control, and also because it would be kind of dickish to my returning supporters if I gave away all or even most of the content they paid for last year. So, y’know, there’s tons more content waiting in the other books of the series, which are available as add-ons. Just saying.

And that’s only scratching the surface! There’s more content in this book than this intro has room for, so there’ll be more updates along the way going into more detail, and all of it crammed into the pages of the Traveler’s Guide to the Darkwood!

boardgame.name: All Hallows Evil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Les Braven was a schlock horror director before the Zombies came. Hell, he even made movies about the walking dead. But no one appreciated his “masterpieces.” He didn’t react well to being shelved as a has-been when the world still worked. Now, he’s determined to make a comeback when no one expects him to. He has rigged an old Victorian house with traps, sealed doors, and, of course, Zombies. Every room has cameras and he plans to lure a group of would-be heroes there, film them as they fight to remain alive, and then edit the footage after the last hero goes down.

All Hallows Evil is a Halloween-themed mission for the Zombicide: Chronicles RPG.

boardgame.name: Hall Marked for Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Holidays used to be something we looked forward to. Even with all the wincing around the Christmas dinner table as uncles and grandparents asked uncomfortable questions, even with the last-minute gift shopping, even with the hassle of travel... we loved the Holidays, or loved to hate them. Now, being a Scrooge is a life skill, and being the Grinch is a valid method of survival.

Hall Marked for Death is a Christmas-themed mission for the Zombicide: Chronicles RPG.

boardgame.name: Wickerbunker Pact: The Unlikely Blessing of a Mistreated Survivor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a time before time, a goblin abducted by a team of adventurers was stuffed within an extraplanar space and taken away due to their strange fascination with the tiny green man. Though he had an unremarkable background, he was frequently subjected to various ploys and traps the group used him for and could not escape their minstrel’s charismatic ways. This bar patron turned heroic accomplice was eventually left to outlive its compatriots due to being playfully fed a series of longevity potions, and a trick of magic granted him eternal life. Now, the goblin Wickerbunker holds the rights to those heroes’ estates, including the magical items and stories they passed down. He grants this power to others who seek curiosity and adventure, favoring those caught up in adventure or trouble they do not understand or did not ask for. Though unremarkable, his experience with getting out of trouble and being in an advantageous position has proved valuable.

This product features the otherwordly patron option a warlock can take at 1st level and four eldritch invocation options they may take.

boardgame.name: Sword & Caravan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sword & Caravan is an OSR setting book for playing a historically accurate fantasy campaign set in the East along the region known as "the Silk Road" at the turn of the 12th/13th Centuries. This historic campaign's timeline is set amid the turbulent era between the Third Crusade and the Mongol Invasions. This marked Europe's earliest period of post-classical interaction with the East.

As Players, you may decide to take on the roles of crusaders, merchants, or explorers traveling to ancient and mysterious lands. Alternatively, you may choose from any number of unique character concepts native to those lands.

With a detailed gazetteer of every region along the Silk Road from the Crusader States and the Muslim world to China, Sword & Caravan gives you everything you need to explore the history and varied cultures of a region filled with war, intrigue, commerce, and conquests.

This book includes:

New classes and magical techniques
Guidelines and mechanics on merchant commerce, social interactions, law & justice
A historically accurate bestiary of medieval monsters local to the setting
Magic items inspired by the myths and legends of every culture in the region
Abundant adventure seeds that GMs can use to hook Players
Random tables and generators to help create encounters with an authentic world feeling

boardgame.name: Dark Visitations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF collects two early scenarios written by Kevin Ross, a titan of the Lovecraftian RPG scene and one of the writers responsible for setting the long-term direction for the whole hobby in its early days. His career as a published writer began in 1989 (with the publication of a scenario that incidentally first gave famous form to The Yellow Sign), and extended through the most prolific years of the 1990s (during which he wrote Lovecraft Country guidebooks for Kingsport and Innsmouth), right up to today.

But even those earliest published scenarios were not the first Lovecraft-inspired RPG adventures Kevin wrote. In the early-to-mid 1980s, he was already working on numerous such writing projects, completing a number of scenarios. For various reasons, none of those have seen publication.

Until now.

We're thrilled to be able to present two of these early works by Kevin, updated to work with the newest open-source D100 Lovecraftian game engine, but retaining the "old school" sensibility of the 1980s. Both these scenarios pit the Protagonists against the Mi-Go, one of HPL's most imaginative creations.

Interesting in their own right as historical documents ... these adventures also serve as great short bites of genuine classic horror.

—♦—

A Night on Bald Mountain
The Protagonists learn of the curious disappearance of a relative — a reclusive uncle who lived near the town of Augustin, Vermont. Travelling to the remote but verdant region, they will become enmeshed in a mystery which has its roots in dark sorcery … and visitors from beyond the human sphere.

Reclamation Project
The Protagonists encounter a very odd research project being performed in secret at the university in their hometown. Why have so many of the best scientific minds on campus been summoned to provide their expertise? And why have there been a sudden spate of break-ins and prowlers reported around campus?

boardgame.name: Servants of the Loa
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The loa bless and guide us. In return for their blessings, we serve their will. "

For those with the ability and desire there are many mysteries that can be uncovered within the infinities of the akashic records. Paths to power, answers to forbidden questions, and even simple stories. Among these stories are the legends of the loa and the mortals that serve them.
This document includes the following:

The Servant, a divinely touched zodiac alternate class.
The Loa Cosmology.
The Queen’s Effects veil set.
Chaul, a veilweaving archetype for the omdura class.

boardgame.name: Making History: The Great War - The Red Army
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Apart from new units, this expansion also include new empires and a new Late War Scenario which begins in September 1918 called Armistice and Carnage which includes the Russian Civil War and other empires which fell apart in the late and aftermath of World War I.

boardgame.name: What Greed Hath Wrought
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pain, destruction, grief… These are the seeds left to sprout by greed. Deep beneath the lapping waves of the sea, this heartache is felt by an innocent few who wish only to be left to their own devices. Their lives are mere inches from death at the hands of a wild gang of seafaring bandits, and they will soon tip over the edge if help doesn’t arrive quickly.

What Greed Hath Wrought is a fifth-edition compatible adventure for the world's most popular roleplaying game designed for a party of four to six level-nine characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and digital maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: Disjunction
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the trail of a runaway heir, the team is led to the terrestrial megalopolis of Superior, where they must brave the dangers of the mean streets, out of control riots and a fringe cult. In the end, they will run up against a sinister plot that threatens the global order. Will the scrappers stop the "Disjunction?" Or will they simply walk away in order to claim a paycheck?

Disjunction features a tense action horror scenario for Shadows Over Sol. It is designed to run between two and five gaming sessions. Its features include:

A dystopic glimpse of future Earth
Plenty of dark sci-fi action
A new fringe cult: the Order of Gabriel Archangel the Revelator
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: Liber Sanguinis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Liber Sanguinis is a player-focused supplement that was developed along with the Fanged Fables kickstarter. Liber Sanguinus contains vampire and undead themed character options that can be used to provide vampiric flavor to any character class.

Each of the 12 base classes have new character subclasses made that follow a vampiric or undead theme.
Several new vampiric themed spells.
A few vampiric magic items.
3 vampire themed character backgrounds.

boardgame.name: The Saurian Sanctum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 2 to 4
Intended for Use with Most Fantasy Roleplaying Games

The peaceful seaside hamlet of Pertween has been attacked by a band of lizardfolk!
The normally reclusive and insular swamp dwellers have taken several folk captive.
The locals ask for your help; will you enter the saurians’ swamp to save the day?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am pleased to announce the release of the fifteenth adventure in my Old School Series, THE SAURIAN SANCTUM. In this adventure your players will be tasked with rescuing a group of villagers kidnapped by a raiding part of lizard folk. The aquatic raiders assaulted a peaceful seaside village, took half a dozen of them captive, and then fled back into their swamp. The players stumble onto the aftermath of this raid and the local sheriff begs them to set off into the swamp after the lizard folk to rescue those taken. This scenario is a low level adventure intended for 4 to 6 players of levels 2 to 4.

Synopsis: The adventure in this scenario takes place in and around the hamlet of Pertween, a small fishing settlement along the southern coast of The Red Eagle Barony. While this region of the Barony experiences occasional trouble with pirate raids, lying as it does near the outlaw infested Veridian Isles, the area is generally peaceful, thanks to the protection provided by the unseen elvish forces which patrol the Dlútha Forest.

The inhabitants of Pertween are mostly halflings and gnome whose focus is on working the sea and living their lives, and they take little notice of and have no trouble with the aquatic humanoids that dwell in the nearby swamp, taking a live and let live attitude toward them. For the most part they have had little interaction and no interference from their reclusive saurian neighbors, who seemed content to shun the outside world…until recently.

Outside agitators, Chaotic fish folk known as the Garlië, have riled up the normally Neutral lizard folk. At the behest of their dark masters, a Garlië war band has come to the swamp and begun banging the drums of war. They have spread lies of imminent invasion by human and demi-humans forces. Playing on the lizard folks’ fear and mysticism, the Garlië priestess Nes’kess she has pushed them to preemptively strike Pertween, and commanded the taking of several hostages. These captives have been brought deep into the swamp, to a venerable sanctum of the lizard folk, where Nes’kess has vowed to use the captives’ souls to bring the lizard folk leaders entombed there back to life, to lead them in the coming struggle for their very survival.

Will you players take up the sheriff’s quest and rescue these captives before their souls are devoured?
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Negligee: Spring Clean
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The first full-size sequel to Negligee about girls working in a lingerie shop at the huge spring sale! As the female manager of the store you have to help the girls handling the busy shop - and maybe get one (or more) of them for yourself.

boardgame.name: Negligee: Girls Night
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Follow the story of Hannah as she is running the lingerie store Negligee after the previous manager Karen, who now returns as part owner and investor. The two girls have to rebuild their relationship - the professional, but perhaps also a personal...

boardgame.name: Siege of Mantua
boardgame.description:
Two armies march to the relief of the fortress and its exhausted garrison. One from the East, and one from the North, converging on the outnumbered enemy. That enemy was the Army of Italy, the first field command of Napoleon Bonaparte. The fifteen days that followed would make him a legend.

Taking as its subject Bonaparte's famous Arcole campaign, Siege of Mantua is a game of operational maneuver and tactical daring. Players move blocks on the mapsheet to threaten and deceive their opponent, with the object of bringing them to a decisive battle. These are fought on a battle display with counters drawn randomly from your unit pool. The quality of your pool improves with every victory; suffering losses will damage morale, degrading unit quality.

You must master both of these spheres if you wish to be victorious. Though outnumbered, the French player has the benefit of moving along interior lines, allowing greater coordination of forces. But those men are stretched thin to deal with two distinct lines of enemy advance. The Austrian player can use this to their advantage, bringing superior forces to bear at weak points in the enemy line. What results is a desperate battle of wits and nerve, and a novel take on the "block game" genre.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Negligee: Opposites Attract
boardgame.description:
User Summary

After Charlotte's long term girlfriend Mikki left her, Sophie insist to take Charlotte out to try to cheer her up - but Sophie is kind of a minx, so the "date" might end up more hot than Charlotte expected...

boardgame.name: Hentai Asmodeus
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Hentai sex simulator game - but before the fun you need to break some seals set by demons by completing some arcade puzzles like in Zuma.

The game is censored but there is a free nude patch available.

boardgame.name: Dystopia
boardgame.description:
In Dystopia, zombies, tsunamis, viruses, atomic explosions threaten all continents.
Who among you will succeed in eliminating as many dangers as possible from their continent to save humanity?
Observation, memorization, deduction, cunning and strategy will be your best allies to win the game.
The goal: to have as few dangers as possible on his threatened continent to get out of it!

Each player chooses a continent.
On his turn either he takes the first card from the discard pile, or he takes the first card from the draw pile.

If he chooses a card face up he must swap it with a card from his deck and place it face up.

If he chooses a card from the draw pile, he chooses whether he keeps it or not.

If, at the end of his turn, a player thinks he has a minimum number of danger points, he announces "Dystopia", which triggers the last turn, then the players reveal their cards and count the points.

boardgame.name: Infinity N4: Rules Annex
boardgame.description: The Infinity N4 Rules annex is an annex to the Infinity N4 ruleset containing a series of rules, special skills, weapons, and pieces of equipment which have been adapted to the N4 system, but with a provisional nature. The annex includes rules for fireteams, new special skills, weaponry, and equipment. Rules included here are completely official, however they may be modified in further expansions of the N4 ruleset.

boardgame.name: Spell Out!
boardgame.description:
Spell Out! is an all-new word game from Next Dimension Games. 1-4 players race to claim words on the board before their opponents, blocking other players moves on the way and claiming bonuses wherever possible. Choose your words carefully - the game depends on it!

Play starts by revealing a challenge card, for example 'words with the blend CK' and each come up with a 5-letter word that fits, e.g. cloCK. Players then take it in turns to move their pieces on the board, aiming to line them up with all the letters in their word before their opponents.

Letters on the outer ring are worth double points if you can get them into a word, and there's 3 bonus tiles that can be any letter, but their use is limited!

With gates that cause the game board to be a new challenge every game, randomised start positions and two difficulty levels of cards, Spell Out is the always-fresh word game for families and skilful wordsmiths alike.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Abomination Vaults (5E)
boardgame.description:
'User Summary'

Compilation of The Abomination Vaults, converted for 5th Edition D&D.

boardgame.name: The Bai Ze and the Book of Monster
boardgame.description:
From inside of book

Welcome to Ekratoria
Welcome to the world of Ekratoria.

This campaign begins in Levos and is the first campaign set in the universe of Luminous Ages. You are tasked with hunting down the villains that have stolen the Bai Ze Tu and rescuing the Bai Ze. Many creatures have been unleashed on the land due to the machinations of the masked one. Some creatures are good but may have been corrupted. Many creatures are also simply evil. It is your quest to find these creatures during your journey from Levos to Adaross, capturing, killing, or saving them. You will encounter many obstacles, make friends, find foes and quests along the way. Be creative, have fun and may the light of the Luminary guide you.

boardgame.name: Jumping Jack
boardgame.description: Each player has five matching "Jacks" which are shot from spring-loaded launchers onto one of five plastic towers. The round ends when all ten jacks have been shot (you can knock off your opponent's pieces). Round score is calculated and the highest score after five rounds wins.

boardgame.name: Dune: Imperium – The GiftForge Insert
boardgame.description:
Tested with premium sleeved cards.
This product does not require assembly.

Insert size: 28,7 cm x 28,9 cm x 6,4 cm.
The product won't lift the lid.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.

The insert can be ordered with or without player boards. The player board version contains 4 pcs of boards.

boardgame.name: Dune: Imperium – The GiftForge player board
boardgame.description:
Tested with premium sleeved cards.
This product does not require assembly.

Insert size: 21 x 18 cm x 6 mm.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.

boardgame.name: Hová bújtál, katica?
boardgame.description:
The beetles that live in flower meadows are in great danger. A hungry bird could fly by at any moment and, if it spots them, it could eat them. But the beetles have learned how to become almost invisible in the grass. Help them hide too!

A fun development board game that's great fun for younger children, so the whole family can play together.

The aim of the game is for each player to collect and hide 4 beetles under the grass. Since the beetles are different sizes, the plants that hide them are also different sizes. The ladybird can be hidden by the smallest grass, while the potato beetle can be hidden by the medium size and the deer beetle by the largest.

boardgame.name: Dark Secrets of Africa
boardgame.description:
"In the year 1876, the followers of the god Azag-Thot created a lot of excitement in Africa. The brotherhood of Marduk and the follower of Anubis fought against the Azag-Thot clan. Great luck that the historian Howard Hawk (you) traveled through Africa and supported the Marduk/Anubis clan against the Azag-Thot.

In this game, you play Howard Hawk, the aforementioned historian. In 15 different areas of Africa he can use his father's old rifle. There are lots of Azag-Thot munchs, cursed spidermen, or other terrible creatures. In every area is at least one occult place where mighty books, broken amulets or magic swords can be found. Only with these goods can the Azag-Thot be defeated.

By your quest you were supported from up to 6 African inhabitants. These are carrying your equipment. By the time you learn some magic that help you to solve your quest."

- from https://www.mobygames.com/game/dark-secrets-of-africa
boardgame.videogameversion: Afrika Sötét Titkai Windows Cd rom Edition

boardgame.name: 复苏：破封 (Recovery: Break the Seal)
boardgame.description:
The Resuscitators resuscitate in this era. The Human Restart Seal Array attempts to reseal the Resuscitators. After the Resuscitator noticed the seal formation, they decided to lead the army to attack the city. The City Manager only needs to defend the city to win.

复苏：破封 ("Recovery: Break the Seal")is an asymmetrical two-player card game. One player playing The Resuscitators use rule like Smash Up. Other player playing The City Manager use DBG rule against The Resuscitator.

The Resuscitators must defeat the battlefield within a limited time to win. Conversely, the City Manager only needs to hold to win.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ¡Vamos que nos vamos!
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

¡Vamos que nos vamos! es un suplemento compuesto por seis aventuras autoconclusivas e independientes creadas por diferentes autores e ilustradas por Jagoba Lekuona. Los escenarios son igualmente del estilo de los cuatro que vienen en el manual, es decir, aventuras bastante locas de ambiente contemporáneo (con una sola excepción). Con ¡Vamos que nos vamos! tendrás cachondeo garantizado en tu mesa de juego al 100%.

INCLUYE LAS SIGUIENTES AVENTURAS:

El secreto ibérico de Villamansa del Recoleto (de Eduardo Rodríguez Herrera).
En In the gueto (de Ernesto Orellana «Emod»).
Dungeons & Yayos (de Ignacio Sánchez Aranda).
Viaje al centro de la obra (de Marian Pérez de Diego).
Operación Reguetón (de Antonio Lozano Lubián).
Duro Benidorm (de Paco Miranda).

boardgame.name: Battle Of The Breweries
boardgame.description:
Battle Of The Breweries Season 1 Card Game is a fast paced and strategic game, that pits rival breweries against each other.

The worlds first Trading Card game featuring real world breweries and beers.
130 breweries are a part of Season 1 from 30 countries!

Take control of a world renowned brewery as a brand new co-owner!
Your first task? Build the greatest taproom in the world for your fans to flock to.
Along the way, you'll have to source beers within your fans favourite ABV% range, stock beers that are linked to your brewery, find the glassware that compliments your beers and locate your breweries Pet or Mascot.
It all sounds too easy, but your rivals have decided to copy your plans. You won't know who they are or what they're trying to source themselves, and you'll have to defend yourself from thieves and attackers that are out to steal your items.

It's time to fight your way to glory and become the greatest brewery in the world!


Includes the Trading Cards of 15 breweries inside, along with everything you need to take on your rival breweries in a strategic, fast paced and exciting game.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: La ingesta indigesta
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

La ingesta indigesta es una aventura escrita por Isabel Rísquez Navajas y Antonio Lozano Lubián para IMSERSO to the limit.

En esta aventura de horror gastronómico, los Personajes Jubilados van a disfrutar del alojamiento en régimen de pensión completa en el Hotel-Restaurante-Gastrobar “Cornucopia”. En seguida comprobarán que se come muy, pero que muy bien allí. ¡Y en grandes cantidades! También tendrán ocasión de darse un garbeo por las provincias de Córdoba y Málaga, gracias a unas excursiones organizadas en las que tendrán lugar unos episodios… ¡raros no, lo siguiente! Depende de los PJ descubrir el pastel y acabar con la fuente del terror en esta aventura no apta para todos los estómagos. ¡No olvidéis echar un protector gástrico en la maleta!

boardgame.name: Los abuelos de la justicia
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Los abuelos de la justicia es una historia de heroica senectud en la que un grupo de Personajes Jubilados viaja a la ínclita ciudad de Cádiz para disfrutar del buen tiempo, asistir a sus mundialmente famosos carnavales y vivir las chirigotas en riguroso directo, que siempre es la mar de divertido. Pero muy pronto los ancianos descubrirán que no es oro todo lo que reluce: el animador sociocultural es un plasta, van a tener que disfrazarse del primero al último, acceder al teatro Falla para ver las chirigotas no es tan fácil como pensaban y... luego... Bueno, luego ocurren TODAS ESAS COSAS (¡!).
¿Tendrán los PJ las agallas necesarias para convertirse en los auténticos héroes de la película?
Prepárate para una aventura realmente loca de IMSERSO to the limit que, como dicen ahora los jóvenes, ¡es súper!

boardgame.name: Age of Steam on Saturn 2101
boardgame.description:
This is a solo and duo expansion!

Released in July 2022, one more city is becoming black each round!

Tips: Wrap around and use the Wind Action!

Will you be able to deliver all colored cubes before the end of the game ? If you liked on the Moon, you will love on Saturn 2101!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Love Battle! High School: Our Powers Combine! promo
boardgame.description: A set of 5 promotionals card that require a pairing of two set characters in the same room to activate. Released in the 2022 Convention season.

boardgame.name: Nivel 9 (Número 1 - Abr 2014)
boardgame.description:
Nivel 9, nº 1.
(Descripción de la web de la editorial)

Nace una nueva revista de juegos de rol de mano de Colectivo 9 y Nosolorol Ediciones. Siguiendo la estela de las clásicas revistas de juegos de rol, Nivel 9 pretende ser un reflejo de aquellos tiempos adaptado a los nuevos diseños y con material de máxima actualidad.

La nueva revista Nivel 9 contiene, en sus 64 páginas, material para tus juegos favoritos de Nosolorol Ediciones: entrevistas, módulos, escenarios, ayudas de juego, avances... Todo lo que puedas necesitar para expandir tu experiencia de juego.

El primer número de la revista contiene: dos aventuras completas (una para Dreamraiders y otra para Hitos); una ambientación de ciencia ficción para NSd20; una entrevista a Jim Butcher y dos avances de juego (Dresden Files y Reflejo); varias ayudas de juego para Fragmentos, Aquelarre, NSd20, Hitos, El Reino de la Sombra y Eyes Only y dos nuevos escenarios (El Reino de la Sombra y La Mirada del Centinela).

Además este primer número cuenta con la colaboración de Ricard Ibáñez (Aquelarre), Ismael Díaz Sacaluga (Dreamraiders) y Jordi Martín (Reflejo), sin olvidar la tira cómica de Andrés Palomino (Crónicas PSN). Un primer número repleto de contenido para dar la bienvenida a la nueva revista de juegos de rol.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Miedo en el campo de batalla
La vieja (y nueva) aparición del camino...

boardgame.name: Nivel 9 (Número 2 - Jul 2014)
boardgame.description:
Nivel 9, nº 2.
(Descripción de la web de la editorial)

Nace una nueva revista de juegos de rol de mano de Colectivo 9 y Nosolorol Ediciones. Siguiendo la estela de las clásicas revistas de juegos de rol, Nivel 9 pretende ser un reflejo de aquellos tiempos adaptado a los nuevos diseños y con material de máxima actualidad.

La nueva revista Nivel 9 contiene, en sus 64 páginas, material para tus juegos favoritos de Nosolorol Ediciones: entrevistas, módulos, escenarios, ayudas de juego, avances... Todo lo que puedas necesitar para expandir tu experiencia de juego.

El segundo número de la revista contiene: cinco aventuras (una para Aquelarre, dos para Fragmentos, una para Eyes Only y otra para El Reino de la Sombra), una ambientación para La Mirada del Centinela y la segunda parte de la ambientación de ciencia ficción para NSd20, REACT 2.3, una entrevista a Luis Royo y Rómulo Royo y un avance de juego (Plenilunio), tres ayudas de juego (una para El Reino de la Sombra, otra para Pequeños Detectives de Monstruos y una ayuda sobre la música en la mesa de juego) y un minijuego completo: La Mitad Oscura.

Además este segundo número cuenta con la colaboración de Álvaro Corcín y Patricia de Blas, los autores de Pequeños Detectives de Monstruos, y una nueva tira cómica de Andrés Palomino (Crónicas PSN).
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Dominus Malus o El Mal Señor
Entrevista a Luis Royo y Rómulo Royo
Jugando a Pequeños Detectives de Monstruos

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #14)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this fourteenth issue (which is slightly shorter due to COVID):

For Infinity's Edge, a Specialist and Advanced Class in Crafting Classes
In Thunderscape TinyD6, learn about the the Outriders of the Rhanate and the Magisters of Le'Ciel in Law & Order!
In Tiny Legacies, meet teen heroes and explorers of the multiverse in The Crossroads!
In Random Heroes, meet the coporate speedster Xcelerate!

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 21 - Mar 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tears of Ishme adventure path continues this issue with another 5e compatible adventure which can be combined with last months adventure or run on its own as a side quest. It fits any adventure that has a volcano in!

(Come on, you can add a volcano to any adventure - this is fantasy RPG land!)

In the fire caves are new creatures, new magic items and new NPCs - with a hot and fiery theme!

This is a fully illustrated fantasy RPG magazine that is system-neutral so fits for ANY fantasy RPG game system. Designed in a modern landscape format this is chock full of ideas for you as a Dungeon Master or Games Master.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral (adventure has 5e stats) Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Gaming Advice - Exploring isolated NPCs and organisations (5 pgs)

6 Adventure Hooks (1 pg)

Hot Footed Terrain - 7 different and exotic terrain types/events that might occur in volcanic region or inside fire caves (3 pgs)

Hal and Rogers Creature Report - featuring 5 new creatures and 1 new plant! (6 pgs)

Tears of Ishme 5e Compatible Adventure (10 pgs)

5 Detailed NPCs (6 pgs)

Magic Items - five new magic items introduced (3.5 pgs)

Ishme - The Crying Goddess - New diety introduced (3 pgs)

20 Trinkets and Treasures - to be found by characters and puzzled over! (1.5pgs)

Game Advice on how to game with fire and not get burnt (3 pgs)

Picture Prompt - creative questions and scenario ideas around a specific image (3pgs)

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 22 - Apr 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tears of Ishme adventure path continues this issue with another 5e compatible adventure which can be combined with last months adventure or run on its own as a side quest. It fits any adventure that has a jungle in it.

In the jungle are new creatures, lots of new plants and fungi and new NPCs.

This is a fully illustrated fantasy RPG magazine that is system-neutral so fits for ANY fantasy RPG game system. Designed in a modern landscape format this is chock full of ideas for you as a Dungeon Master or Games Master.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral (adventure has 5e stats) Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Game Advice - When is a Jungle not a jungle p6
Creature Report - p9
Jade Unicorn - p10
Bolinna - p12
Bolinna Warden - pg 13
Mantodire - pg 14
Razerback Hydra - pg15
Plant Magic - Pg 16
Known Your Mushrooms - Pg 17
Fantasy Mushrooms - Pg 18
Jungle Plants - Pg 19
Fantasy Jungle Plants - Pg 24
NPCs - Pg 25
Seta, Guide - Pg 26
Timrek, Questing Paladin - Pg 27
Umt'Salane, Witch Doctor - Pg 28
Kakatacha, King in Exile - Pg 29

20 Jungle Rumours - Pg 32
Tears of Ishme, Episode 4 - (5e side treck) Pg 34 - 45
Ritual Thunder - Ritual Advice - Pg 46
Ritual of Charming - Pg 48
Ritual of Tree Vision - Pg 48
Ritual of Parrot Talker - Pg 49
Ritual of The Root - Pg 49
Young Jungle Dragon - Pg 50

boardgame.name: Nivel 9 (Número 3 - Nov 2014)
boardgame.description:
Nivel 9, nº 3.
(Descripción de la web de la editorial)

Nivel 9 número 3 ya ha llegado, con todo lo que necesitas de tus juegos favoritos y un suplemento con Fracking una aventura para Estrellas Anónimas.

Nace una nueva revista de juegos de rol de mano de Colectivo 9 y Nosolorol Ediciones. Siguiendo la estela de las clásicas revistas de juegos de rol, Nivel 9 pretende ser un reflejo de aquellos tiempos adaptado a los nuevos diseños y con material de máxima actualidad.

La nueva revista Nivel 9 contiene, en sus 64 páginas, material para tus juegos favoritos de Nosolorol Ediciones: entrevistas, módulos, escenarios, ayudas de juego, avances... Todo lo que puedas necesitar para expandir tu experiencia de juego.

El tercer número de la revista contiene: tres aventuras (una para Eyes Only, otra para Cthulhu d100 y Cultos Innombrables y otra para La Mirada del Centinela), la tercera parte de la ambientación de ciencia ficción para NSd20, REACT 2.3, una entrevista a Fred Hicks, un avance de juego de Unrealms y cinco ayudas de juego (para Cultos Innombrables, Aquelarre, El Reino de la Sombra, La Torre de Rudesindus y Fragmentos). Como extra, este número de la revista, incluye Fracking, un suplemento de doce páginas para Estrellas Anónimas con tintes sobrenaturales.

Además, este tercer número cuenta con la colaboración de Ricardo Dorda, David García, Albert Tarrés y otros muchos más colaboradores habituales de Nosolorol Ediciones, junto a una nueva tira cómica de Andrés Palomino (Crónicas PSN).
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Luz del Primer Día. Misión 1: Visitando el Elba

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 23 - May 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tears of Ishme adventure path continues this issue with another 5e compatible adventure which can be combined with the previous months adventures or run on its own as a side quest. It features the characters teleporting into an underground shrine and then most likely captured! So, could be easily adapted for almost any ongoing campaign.

This is a fully illustrated fantasy RPG magazine that is system-neutral so fits for ANY fantasy RPG game system. Designed in a modern landscape format this is chock full of ideas for you as a Dungeon Master or Games Master.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral (adventure has 5e stats) Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Welcome - Pg 3
Anatomy of a Villain - Pgs 6 - 9
Tilting at Windmills - Pgs 10 - 12
Millers, NPCs Story Hooks - Pgs 13
Magical Windmills - Pgs 14 - 16
Creature Report Pg 17
Gengat Pg 18 - 19
Wodlieger Pg 20
Zoki Beetle Swarm Pg 21
Beakpigs Pg 22
Villaneous NPCs Pg 23
Mistress De Milo, City Councellor Pg 24
Skalaglava, Warlord Pg 25
Emmanual Gilderson, Merchant Pg 26
Aster McDonald , Watch Commander Pg 27
Karlown, Ship Yard Owner Pg 28
Captain Lutrin, Smuggler Pg 29
NPC Adventure Hooks Pg 30
Exciting River Crossings Pg 31 - 32
So Bad, They're Good (Quality Villains) Pg 33 - 35
Magic Items Pg 36 - 37
Lowlands, Location Delve 38 - 41
Tears of Ishme, Adventure Path, 5e Side Quest 42 - 49
Bad Boys and Wicked Women AKA Why Being Bad is Sexy 50 - 53
Picture Prompt - 54

boardgame.name: 八雲さんはトリテしたい (Yakumo-san Wa Torite Shitai)
boardgame.description:
八雲さんはトリテしたい (Yakumo-san Wa Torite Shitai), roughly translated as "Yakumo wants to play a trick-taking game", is a trick-taking game for 1 to 4 players themed around eyeglasses.

The game includes a board which pictures a pair of glasses with spaces around it for players' pieces. The winner of a trick chooses a card from the trick and advances their marker a number of spaces corresponding to the rank. The different spaces are worth a different number of points.

Additionally, the 0 card causes each token to immediately advance 1 space.

The game can be played for one hand or over a series of hands. In both methods of scoring, the winner will be the one who best maximizes the point value of where the piece is on the glasses board when the hand ends.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Avel: New Adventures
Kroniki zamku Avel: Nowe opowieści
boardgame.description:
Chronicles of Avel: New Adventures is an exciting big expansion for Chronicles of Avel, in which players will once more become heroes and heroines with an epic quest to help the magical land of Avel. The game introduces 3 thematic scenarios which can be played separately or as a campaign and 3 modules that can be used in different combinations to create personalized challenges. Players will have to cooperate to choose the best strategy, support each other and win.

In Chronicles of Avel: New Adventures players will continue exploring the world of Avel, using modular board created from hexagonal tiles. New place tiles, equipment, monsters and a new Beast will give opportunity to tell new stories in a much more immersive way. This expansion is an answer to requests made by players - containing all necessities to make Chronicles of Avel even better!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: King of Tokyo: Even More Wicked!
boardgame.description:
The King of Tokyo Dark collector's edition Wickedness Gauge is getting its own micro expansion!

This expansion includes the Wickedness board, 10 Wickedness tiles and all 15 counters representing every monsters in the King of Tokyo base game and expansions.

In addition to victory Points, 1's and 2's grant you Wickedness Points as follows:


For each three-of-a-kind of 1's, gain 2 Wickedness Points;
For each three-of-a-kind of 2's, gain 1 Wickedness Points;


Track any points gained by moving your Monster counter up the Wickedness Gauge.

If your counter moves onto or beyond the 3 , 6 or 10 space, you may take a tile of your choice from the tiles available at that Wickedness level.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Scourge of the Shadows
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Kingdom of Ereworn lies on the brink of either disaster or salvation.

You have entered this benighted land, where you can either aid or oppose the forces of order.

In this open world gamebook, many adventures await -- explore haunted monasteries, delve into once deserted barrows or investigate cursed forests -- the choice is yours!

boardgame.name: Mountain of Lanterns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure taking place in a magical/divine place.

A town up in the mountains has something to hide. Where the graves climb the mountainside and they all have lanterns burning. But what about the murmuring stone and the frozen body without a grave? The team will not make themselves popular if they disturb the greatest festivities of the year.

boardgame.name: We All Fall Down
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As summer approaches, the survivors must decide whether to remain at the secluded cottage, or press on to Camp Hope with Alyssa. A chance encounter with a small party of survivors presents a unique opportunity and reveals an inconvenient truth.

We All Fall Down is the eighth episode, and the season one finale of The Living Dead Campaign. This unorthodox Savage Worlds Plot Point Campaign for Dead End takes your Novice survivor characters through the first year of the zombie apocalypse with a recurring series of monthly episodes that tell the gripping tale of fear and survival in a world claimed by the dead.

boardgame.name: Terra Nova
boardgame.description: Terra Nova is a simplified version of the strategy game Terra Mystica. In the game, up to four players each control one of ten factions, each with different abilities. Compete against one another to explore new territories in peaceful competition, erect buildings, and achieve certain goals from round to round. Use your faction's special abilities in a clever way to control the largest territory at game's end and finish with the most points.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: My Cute Roommate
boardgame.description:
User Summary

After your high school years are over, it is time to think about the future; you need to pick a good college, find your self a job - and a girlfriend.

At this time you unfortunately get diagnosed with a mysterious illness - but there is only one way to cure it, and that require women...

boardgame.name: Adventure Module H2: A Rocky Road
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rocky Road is a wind-swept taiga sixteen days north from the alkali scrublands of the southern Golden Empire of Enen and a fortnight west of the topless towers of the snow elfs. This is a vast, sprawling wilderness of rolling hills, of snow-capped peaks, of lush, verdant forests of larchwood and stately pine, and of cool, dark streams. This is not a land people travel willingly, and you are likely no exception; said to contain treasures mysterious and magical from before the Great Thaw, when the snow elfs ruled everything north of the Great Swamp, it has become a haunt of dwimmer and worse things. Few caravans travel this far north; those that do are rare and expensive to secure passage.

To find the treasures of the Rocky Road, you must travel where the caravans do not.

This is an introductory OSR mini-hexcrawl for Jared Sinclair's The Vanilla Game and is the second entry in the H-series of adventure modules. It contains 18 pages of encounters, plot hooks and a map for level 1 characters to explore and can be used as a standalone hexcrawl adventure for when PCs are traveling from one region to another or as the basis of a longer campaign.

boardgame.name: Criminal Organization Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of fighting crime? Then why not create a criminal organization and get the other side of the story...

This product contains:

3 tables for the description of the organization (name, main activity, members' distinctive sign),
3 tables for the structure (type of people recruited, initiation rite, organization type),
a table of 20 backgrounds for the organization's boss,
3 more tables focusing on the organization's hideout or front, its finances, and a possible special feature

boardgame.name: Hot Hentai Puzzle Vol. 1
Hot Hentai Puzzle Vol.1
boardgame.description:
User Summary

10 tile-swapping puzzles with hentai girls (contain full nudity).

Not to be confused with Wipe Studio's Hentai Hot Puzzles.

boardgame.name: Giant Options
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In [this] Unearthed Arcana, we explore character options related to the magic and majesty of giants. This playtest document presents the Path of the Giant barbarian subclass, the Circle of the Primeval druid subclass, the Runecrafter wizard subclass, and a collection of new feats

boardgame.name: Hot Hentai Puzzle Vol. 2
Hot Hentai Puzzle Vol.2
boardgame.description:
User Summary

12 hentai themed game with tile-swapping puzzles. The game contains full nudity.

boardgame.name: The Coroner Saga: Episode 2 - The Body Don't Lie
The Coroner Saga: Episode 2 - When night falls
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Sara gets herself involved in another murder case, but also has to juggle her private life.

The episode seems to be having two titles.

boardgame.name: The Coroner Saga: Episode 3 - Deadly Truth
boardgame.description:
User Summary

As an unresolved murder haunts Sara's dreams, we explore her past: Why did she become a coroner - was it her dream - or perhaps her nightmare?

boardgame.name: Sports Dice: Soccer
boardgame.description:
Roll your way to victory with Sports Dice Soccer!

Sports Dice Soccer is a fast paced, easy to learn and quick to play dice game that gives players all the action of a real Soccer game. Roll your dice and kick the ball in the opponent’s net to score! The first player with 3 points wins the game.

Sports Dice Soccer is an ideal game for all Soccer fans ages 7 and up. It is the latest addition to the Sports Dice’s series.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Απίθανοι Ήχοι (Incredible Sounds)
boardgame.description:
A game for children who are called to recognize sounds that are being played to them by the provided two CDs. They are then marked by token on boards and on the end the one who has identified the most sounds correctly wins!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Hoverforce
boardgame.description:
Top Gun Meets Blade Runner.

The year: 2050. Biotechnology has irrevocably changed our lives, and the world now faces a deadly new breed of criminal called Alterants. These mutant slimelords have gained control of all street life via distribution and sales of a contraband biotech serum known as "Aftershock".

To stop them, public officials have created an elite battalion of genetically enhanced "public enforcers" known as the Red Wasp Unit. You are the best of the best. Strapped into your hard-firing, hyper-fast Hoverkill 1000 urban assault skimmer, you are the ultimate bio-warrior.

Your mission is clear: Interdict supply runs. Terminate Alterants.

-- from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Chaos Before the Mast (DCC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Somewhere in the middle of the ocean lies a wizard’s prized possession, and he’s offered you a handsome reward for retrieving it. All you need do is set sail on the Intrepid Eel! On your journey, you will work and play alongside the crew, brave fierce squalls, battle the cursed ship Albatross...and face the monster of the sea, the Dread Grampus!

Chaos Before the Mast is a Dungeon Crawl Classics-compatible nautical adventure for 4–6 2nd-level characters. Prepare to sing sea shanties, swab the decks, and battle the creatures of the deep!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Chaos Before the Mast (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Somewhere in the middle of the ocean lies a wizard’s prized possession, and he’s offered you a handsome reward for retrieving it. All you need do is set sail on the Intrepid Eel! On your journey, you will work and play alongside the crew, brave fierce squalls, battle the cursed ship Albatross...and face the monster of the sea, the Dread Grampus!

Chaos Before the Mast is a 5e-compatible nautical adventure for 4–6 2nd-level characters. Prepare to sing sea shanties, swab the decks, and battle the creatures of the deep!
